content:
Diagnosis:		Solid-pseudopapillary neoplasm of pancreas

Management:		12 Apr 2024 Distal pancreatectomy and splenectomy

Histology:		Solid-pseudopapillary neoplasm, 4.2cm, R0 resection margins, no lymphovascular invasion. Beta-catenin nuclear positive. Ki67 2%.

Current situation:	First post-operative oncology review

[redacted name] attended clinic today following recent surgery. She has made an excellent recovery from her operation with minimal post-operative complications. Her surgical wounds have healed well and she reports good appetite. She is managing a normal diet without symptoms of malabsorption. Her weight is stable at 64kg.

On examination, her surgical wounds are well-healed. Abdomen is soft and non-tender with no palpable masses. Performance status is 0.

Given the complete resection and favourable histological features, no adjuvant treatment is required. We will arrange surveillance CT scan at 6 months and see her back in clinic with the results. She has been advised to contact us if she develops any new symptoms in the meantime.
